DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Skeletal Muscle Tissue Anatomic Subsite Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The location of the skeletal muscle from which the specimen was collected.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Skeletal Muscle Tissue Anatomic Subsite
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Striated muscles that are under voluntary control of the organism.  They are connected at either or both ends to a bone and are utilized for locomotion and other movements._Relating to anatomy._A position within another named site.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: Striated muscles that are under voluntary control of the organism.  They are connected at either or both ends to a bone and are utilized for locomotion and other movements.:Relating to anatomy.:A position within another named site.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2: A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.: In a place or position that is lower.: A small flat triangular bone in front of the knee that articulates with the femur and protects the knee joint.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.
In a place or position that is lower.
A small flat triangular bone in front of the knee that articulates with the femur and protects the knee joint.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A large muscle in the back of the lower leg. Its action involves the plantar flexion of the foot.

Concepts.definition: A large muscle in the back of the lower leg. Its action involves the plantar flexion of the foot.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1: A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.: In a place or position that is lower.: The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.
In a place or position that is lower.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
